description:
We are looking for a self-motivated, responsible, and ambitious team player who wants to join our customer success operation team and assist us with various tasks.
 The CS Operations Specialist will play an active role in driving Atera's customer success operational efforts, focused on complex project planning, managing and execution. The ideal candidate is a hard worker, passionate about solving problems, enjoys working with others, and has a positive can-do approach.
 This is an exciting opportunity to learn about CS and project management from the ground up and to work with all departments: Marketing, Product, Development, BI, Support, and Finance. We would love to have you on board if you are interested in developing these areas of expertise.
Come be a part of our growing team!
Responsibilities:
Manage projects from beginning to end, including hands-on work as needed
Build workflows and procedures along with tracking projects success
Assist in day-to-day operational customer related tasks
Collect outstanding payments from customers
Conduct follow up phone calls to better understand why customers churned
Become a coherent partner of the CS ops team
Requirements:


Requirements:
Student majoring in industrial engineering & management/information system management or related fields
The CS operation student will be expected to work a minimum of 120 monthly hours (at least 60%)
Excellent English- strong written and verbal communication skills
Flexible hours
1+ years of relevant experience in a SaaS company – Advantage
Outstanding project management skills with the ability to multi-task and manage complex projects with attention to details
Ability to prioritize workload in a fast phased environment, to ensure high productivity
Some of our benefits
Atera is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time to learn from your teammates and contemporaries, time off to relax and recharge, community volunteer days, an annual budget to support your learning & growth, a company paid trip and lots more.
More about Atera
Small and medium IT operators are the heroes behind the scenes supporting companies around the world. They care a lot for their clients (external or internal) and often work virtually 24/7. However, small and medium IT service providers have always been underserved.
Atera was built for exactly that. With the vision to simplify and streamline the work of Managed Service Providers and IT professionals. To create something that saves them time, energy, and money. To free them from needing to constantly put out fires.
That vision created the remote-first IT management software – enabling IT professionals to shift from reactive task takers to proactive problem solvers.
Now operating from our beautiful offices on Rothchild in Tel Aviv, Atera is currently used by thousands and thousands of IT professionals all over the world (105+ countries).
As we rapidly grow, our goal remains the same: to transform the IT industry with revolutionary technology, while creating one of the happiest and healthiest work environments in the world.Show more Report

Who are we?
Zencity is re-inventing the way governments listen to, understand, and interact with their residents. Our community insights & analytics platform and community survey solution use advanced NLP and ML algorithms to help government organizations be more data-driven. Our global team of urban enthusiasts and data geeks works with 300 cities and counties - from Los Angeles to Chicago, to Tel Aviv. If you’re passionate about joining a growing and dynamic company focused on leveraging data and tech to work on real-world challenges and radically improve life in cities – your place is with us!
What is the role?
As an Operations Manager at Zencity, you will join our Business Operations team in a part-time position, and be responsible for making sure our day-to-day financial, business operations and administrative matters are handled professionally and expeditiously. In your role, you will provide value to numerous key stakeholders and you’ll gain a strong foothold in a growing and exciting innovative environment.
Responsibilities:
Manage the administrative side of our business operations, supporting our go-to-market, finance, and business operations teams.
Improve the company’s cash flow and cash position by streamlining our collection efforts and making sure the company is paid in a timely fashion.
Manage subscription packages and user administration for key business software.
Monitor IT equipment inventory levels and replenish stock as needed. Perform complete inventory checks of all stock at scheduled intervals.
Develop and implement strategies to improve operational performance and efficiency
Requirements:

Requirements:
University or college graduate with good grades and at least 2 years of professional experience (part or full-time).
Experience in an Office Manager/operation manager role within high-tech organizations - advantage
Fluent professional English - Excellent written and verbal communication skills - must!
Exceptional organizational skills and highly attentive to details.
Ability to follow processes and help formulate processes.
Strong proficiency with working on documents and spreadsheets whether in Office or G-Suite environments.
Assertive yet outgoing and service-oriented personality.
Availability to work US West Coast business hours if neededShow more Report

We are looking for a highly talented industrial engineering student, eager to learn, grow and contribute.
What’s in it for you?
In this role you will get the opportunity to be a key contributor to building the overall programs & portfolio of applied on operational, budget, Headcount, and other planning & control aspects. You will take part of the long-term planning and decisions making impact the entire R&D at Applied Materials Israel. You will get to work with a cross-organizational interfaces from different areas such as project business focals, purchasing, finance and HR.
Our Group:
The Strategic programs group is responsible for Leading the budget and resource planning of the R&D activity and providing a comprehensive decision making platform for applied management
What you'll be doing:
Responsible for several cross-unit processes and/or practices (may include resource management, governance management, ongoing budget/cost management and more)
Proactively provide integrative view and analysis of the various business aspects across the company / projects to enable better decisions making. Create predictive routines and promotes risks mitigation.
Identify & highlight trends/ key issues and present results, pinpointing challenges, areas of concern and possible deviation from established plans in the domains under his responsibility.
Propose action plans and mitigation activities and/ or opportunities for improvement; Compile information and results from different sources and develop reports, analysis, appropriate briefings as required; Work jointly with management to implement action plans.
Responsible for the execution of business improvement initiatives, internal/ strategic project; Perform audits/reviews, proactively identify challenges / opportunities and extract lessons-learned to achieve business goals.
Work to streamline work processes & leverage best practices and standards across the company / projects and design supporting tools for it
What should you have?
Solid proficiency in MS Office suite
Team spirit and service orientation
Strong analytic skills
High quality of data provided, in terms of accuracy, simplicity, format and frequency of update
Interacts with Respect
Displays Confidence and Curiosity
Demonstrates Excellence and Professionalism
Who we are?
Applied Materials Israel is home to the Process Diagnostics and Control business unit (PDC). Based in Rehovot, we develop, manufacture and market cutting-edge machine learning and computer vision-based metrology and inspection products that are essential elements in wafer fabrication. By playing a significant role in enabling the production of the next generation of microchips, our expertise enables our customers to transform possibilities into reality.
Get ready to go hybrid!

Office Manager - Job description
part-time position /Replacement for maternity leave
Location: Hod Hashron, Israel (working hybrid)
 Browzwear’s mission is to revolutionize the fashion industry with our 3D end-to-end solutions.
 We develop innovative and exciting cutting-edge 3D garment simulation technology which enables digital workflow, creative designs, faster time to market, less garment waste, and a digital shopping experience. You will have a chance to play a leading role at the forefront of the digital revolution in the apparel industry.
 We are looking for a talented person to run our office administration and help create a great working environment. As well as general office and support duties, the successful candidate will be involved in dealing with supplies and suppliers, basic financial controls, arranging internal and external events, visitor hospitality, and all the other little jobs that go towards making the office run smoothly.
What You'll Be Doing
Manage the "day-to-day" office routines including office inventory, groceries, office supplies, and maintenance.
Coordinate and communicate with the office facility’s vendors.
Serve as the focal point for office-related and be the point person to all employees with any ongoing requests including maintenance, mailing, shipping, office supplies, office equipment, and administrative bills.
Supporting the finance processes such as payment, preparation of invoices, credit cards, employee expense reports, etc.
Manage company’s travel - including flights, hotels)
Ensure a pleasant working environment and smooth ongoing operation of all administrative needs.

Requirements:

Your Experience & Skills
Experience as an office manager or any admin role -an advantage
People person with a positive attitude and strong service orientation.
Time management skills, ability to multitask and prioritize work.
Good experience with, and reasonable skill level in using a variety of software tools, such as email, Microsoft 365
Fluent in Hebrew and English - both speaking and writing - a must.
Willing to work part-time.Show more Report

Oktopost is revolutionizing the way companies connect with their customers and audiences. We enable B2B marketers fully manage and optimize social media to drive their businesses forward in a scalable and measurable way. Leading B2B organizations all over the world such as ACI Worldwide, Snowflake and Fujitsu are using Oktopost to improve and understand their social presence in order to make better business decisions. We are a global, fast-paced, and innovative start up with offices in Ramat Gan, London, and Grand Rapids (MI).
We’re looking for an experienced Bookkeeper to join our growing Finance team on a part-time basis.
As a Bookkeeper, you’ll be responsible for maintaining financial records, managing priorities, invoices, tax payments, overseeing bank reconciliations on a weekly basis, and cash disbursements.
Responsibilities
Record credit card transactions, invoices, payments and monthly reconciliation
Handle employee expenses
Process accounts payable invoices
Prepare and process payments to suppliers
Assist and support our Controller
Help with month-end book closing
Assemble information for external auditors
Report VAT and 856 to Israel Tax Authority monthly
Requirements
2+ years of experience as a bookkeeper
Level 2 bookkeeper certification
Experience with Priority System
Excellent communication and organizational skills
High level of accuracy and attention to detail
Team player
Good written and verbal English
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks
PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATION AND RESUME IN ENGLISH.Show more Report

job: Financial Administrator & Bookkeeper – Part time, remote
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION: Financial Administrator & Bookkeeper – Part time, remote position

Immediate start

M2: The Institute for Experiential Jewish Education is seeking an experienced, self-motivated financial administrator with bookkeeping qualifications. The financial administrator / bookkeeper will provide overall support for financial operations and projects for both our Nonprofit organizations - Israeli חל"צ and US 501(c)3.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist the VP of Finance and Administration in bookkeeping, financial management, invoicing and reporting processes.
Provide support for various financial operations and projects, for both the US based entity and the Israel based entity
Manage relationships with key external vendors, including outsourced accounting/CFO firm and outsourced bookkeeping firms in Israel and the US

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

As a prerequisite, the candidate must believe in the values of M2 and be driven by its mission.
Solid understanding of bookkeeping and accounts payable/receivable principles
Hands-on experience with accounting and financial software, specifically Hashavshevet. Experience with Quickbooks is a plus.
Proven, hands on, bookkeeping experience, in Israel
Bookkeeping experience in the US and / or bookkeeping experience in nonprofits a plus
High level of proficiency in English a MUST (verbal and written) , all work is in English
Proficiency in MS Office and Mac
Customer service orientation and negotiation skills
Ability to complete work with the highest level of accuracy, attention to detail and efficiency, against effective deadlines.
Exceptional interpersonal / collaborative skills. Must be a team player and work effectively with others to achieve outcomes and solve problems.
Ability to handle confidential information.
Ability to work in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment with limited supervision.
Demonstrated resourcefulness in setting priorities, executing multiple tasks, and achieving objectives.
WHAT M2 OFFERS:

Part time (50%), remote position, (periodically required to come into the office in Jerusalem)
Competitive salary
Generous paid time off policy, plus Jewish and nationally observed holidays
A team of professionals seeking to learn, grow, share and make an impact together

TO APPLY:

This job is a part-time remote position, which may require coming in to the office in Jerusalem periodically. For consideration, please submit a resume to jobs@ieje.org. No phone calls please. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. Due to high volume, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
ABOUT M2:

M2: The Institute for Experiential Jewish Education helps educators and organizations design meaningful educational experiences. Our mission is to promote a proud and inspired community of Jewish educators who possess the personal and professional capacities to help learners find meaning and relevance in Jewish life.

M2 is an Equal Opportunity employer. Personnel are chosen on the basis of ability without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.Show more Report
